verses.text: 耶穌臨別為門徒禱告耶穌講完了這些話，就舉目望天，說：「父啊，時候到了，求你榮耀你的兒子，讓兒子也榮耀你，

words.note: Can be a verb 'to glorify' or a noun 'glory'.
Refers to Jesus Christ in this context.
Refers to Jesus Christ in this context.
Can be a verb 'to glorify' or a noun 'glory'.

verses.text: 正如你把管理全人類的權柄給了他，使他賜永生給你所賜給他的人。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Often refers to divine or official authority.
Used with a verb to form a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 認識你是獨一的真神，並且認識你所差來的耶穌基督，這就是永生。

words.note: Emphasizes the singular nature of God.
Used with a verb to form a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 我在地上已經榮耀了你，你交給我要作的工，我已經完成了。

words.note: Verb 'to glorify' with completion particle.

verses.text: 父啊，現在讓我在你自己面前得著榮耀，就是在創世以前我與你同享的榮耀。

words.note: Can be a verb 'to glorify' or a noun 'glory'.
Can be a verb 'to glorify' or a noun 'glory'.

verses.text: 「你從世上分別出來賜給我的人，我已經把你的名顯明給他們了。他們是你的，你把他們賜給了我，他們也遵守了你的道。

words.note: Common in religious contexts for divine giving.
Used to prepose the object of a verb.
Here, 'yours' formed by '你' + '的'.
In biblical context, often refers to God's word or way/truth.

verses.heading: Jesus Prays for the Disciples

verses.text: 現在他們知道，你所給我的，無論是甚麼，都是從你那裡來的；

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb, often implying 'that which'.
Turns '你所給我的' into a noun phrase: 'that which you gave me'.
Used here to emphasize 'from you'.

verses.text: 因為你賜給我的話，我已經給了他們，他們也領受了，又確實知道我是從你那裡來的，並且信你差了我來。

words.note: Modifies '話' (words).

verses.text: 我為他們求；我不為世人求，而是為你賜給我的人求，因為他們是你的。

words.note: Often implies those not following God in biblical context.
Here, 'yours' formed by '你' + '的'.

verses.text: 我的一切都是你的，你的一切也是我的，並且我因著他們得了榮耀。

words.note: A key theological term for divine splendor and honor.

verses.text: 我不再在這世上，他們卻在這世上，我要到你那裡去。聖父啊，求你因你賜給我的名，保守他們，使他們合而為一，好像我們一樣。

words.note: A title for God the Father.
Commonly used in religious contexts for divine bestowal.
In biblical context, 'name' often implies authority or character.
Often used in a spiritual sense of preserving or guarding.
A classical idiom signifying unity.

verses.text: 我跟他們在一起的時候，因你賜給我的名，我保守了他們，也護衛了他們；他們中間除了那滅亡的人以外，沒有一個是滅亡的，這就應驗了經上的話。

words.note: More formal than '保護' (bǎohù).
Often used for spiritual destruction or eternal death.
Specifically refers to prophecy or scripture being fulfilled.
Refers to what is written in the Bible.

verses.text: 現在我到你那裡去，我在世上說這些話，是要他們心裡充滿我的喜樂。

words.note: Frequently used in Christian contexts for spiritual joy.

verses.text: 我把你的道賜給了他們；世人恨他們，因為他們不屬於這世界，像我不屬於這世界一樣。

words.note: Used to mark the object of a verb before the verb.
In a Christian context, often refers to God's word or message.

words.definition: people of the world, worldly people
words.note: Often refers to non-believers or those focused on earthly things.

verses.text: 我不求你使他們離開世界，只求你保守他們脫離那惡者。

words.note: Refers to Satan or forces of evil.

verses.text: 他們不屬於這世界，像我不屬於這世界一樣。
求你用真理使他們成聖；你的道就是真理。

words.note: Lit. 'become holy'.
Refers to God's word/teaching.

verses.text: 你怎樣差我到世上來，我也怎樣差他們到世上去。

words.note: Often used as a locative phrase.
Often used as a locative phrase.

verses.text: 我為了他們的緣故，自己分別為聖，使他們也因著真理成聖。

words.note: Lit. 'separate and become holy'.
Lit. 'become holy'.

verses.text: 「我不但為他們求，也為那些因他們的話而信我的人求，

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase 'those who believe me'.

verses.heading: Jesus Prays for Believers Everywhere

verses.text: 使他們都合而為一，像父你在我裡面，我在你裡面一樣；使他們也在我們裡面，讓世人相信你差了我來。

words.note: A theological term emphasizing unity.
Refers to God the Father.
Often implies non-believers in biblical context.

verses.text: 你賜給我的榮耀，我已經賜給了他們，使他們合而為一，像我們合而為一。

words.note: A theological term emphasizing unity.
A theological term emphasizing unity.

verses.text: 我在他們裡面，你在我裡面，使他們完完全全合而為一，讓世人知道你差了我來，並且知道你愛他們，好像愛我一樣。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes completeness.
A theological term emphasizing unity.
Often implies non-believers in biblical context.

verses.text: 父啊，我在哪裡，願你賜給我的人也和我同在哪裡，讓他們看見你賜給我的榮耀，因為在創立世界以前，你已經愛我了。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 公義的父啊，世人雖然不認識你，我卻認識你，這些人也知道你差了我來。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Often implies non-believers in biblical context.

verses.text: 我已經把你的名指示他們，還要再指示，使你愛我的愛在他們裡面，我也在他們裡面。」

words.note: Marks the object that precedes the verb.
In biblical context, 'name' often signifies character or authority.
